original: Biel, Nils Karl Magnus, postmästare, Skövde, f. 3/5/84 i Ekby, Skarab. 1., av kyrkoh. C. H. Biel o. Charlotte Nilsson. G. 39 m. Johanna Nilsson. Barn: Johanne Charlotte f. 40, Henrik Johannes 41. — E. o. postexp. i västra distr. 03, e. bitr. i Charlotten-berg 04, v. järnv :pO’Sten i västra distr. 06, tf. postexp. där 08, postexp. där 09, v. Gbg I 16, förste postexp. v. järnv :pO’Sten i västra distr. 19, i Skara 23, förste postassist. där 25, post-mäst. i M’arstrand 30, i Hallsberg 32, i Västervik 41 samt i Skövde sed. 44. RVO, GMnr.
translated:
Biel, Nils Karl Magnus was a postmaster born on May 3rd, 1884 in Ekby, Skaraborg County, Sweden. He was the first child of the Reverend C.H. Biel and Charlotte Nilsson. He married Johanna Nilsson in 1939 and they had two children: Johanne Charlotte, born in 1940, and Henrik Johannes, born in 1941. 

Nils worked as a trainee and postal clerk in the western district in 1903, and as an assistant in Charlottenberg in 1904. He then worked as a western district mail carrier in 1906 and as a temporary postal clerk there in 1908. He was appointed as a postmaster in 1909 and served as a first-class postmaster at the western district train station in 1919, and in Skara in 1923. He became a first-class postal assistant in 1925 and was appointed as a postmaster in Marstrand in 1930, in Hallsberg in 1932, in Västervik in 1941, and in Skövde in 1944. 

Nils Karl Magnus Biel was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) and the Gold Medal of Merit (GMnr.).
